content: 1 skein fine fingering weight shown in cider moon*s icicle in *winter twilight* 500 yards 5 us size zero needles darning needle gauge approx 10 stitches per inch colonial pattern row 1 k5 p1 k2 p1* repeat to end of round row 2 k5 p1 k2 together leaving stitches on needle and knit 1st stitch again slip off needle p1* repeat to end of round piece is worked cuff down cast on 81 stitches and join in round placing marker at beginning of round knit in colonial pattern until piece measures 6 5* or desired length heel knit 39 stitches on one needle from start of round continue in eye of partridge pattern until heel flap measures 2 end by working right side row eye of partridge pattern row 1 ws purl all row 2 k1 sl* to end row 3 purl all row 4 s1 k1* to end turn heel row 1 s1 p20 p2 together p1 turn row 2 s1 k4 ssk k1 turn row 3 purl to one stitch before the gap p2 together p1 turn row 4 knit to one stitch before the gap ssk k1 turn continue turning heel until all stitches have been worked 21 stitches 2007 sock-a-holic katie gusset pick up 22 stitches at each side of the heel flap and knit place marker at beginning and ending of arch stitches there are 41 stitches for the arch to maintain continuity of pattern 65 stitches on bottom 106 stitches total begin decrease for gusset row 1 knit to last three stitches before marker k2 decrease k1 and continue in colonial rib pattern to next marker k1 ssk knit to end row 2 knit working in established pattern on arch of foot continue in established pattern on arch of foot decreasing every other round until there are 82 stitches total foot continue in established pattern until piece measures desired foot length minus 1 5* toe round 1 knit round 2 knit to last three stitches before 1st marker k2 together k1 marker k1 ssk knit to last three stitches before 2nd marker k2 together k1 marker k1 ssk knit to end of round repeat these two row until there are 20 stitches on each side of the marker for a total of 40 stitches bind off toe using kitchener stitch 2007 sock-a-holic katie
